description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves touted new funding for Britain’s National Health Service as an upside for voters in a crunch budget this week expected to be dominated by tax hikes and extra borrowing.
title: Reeves Touts NHS Funding as Salve to Labour’s Tax-Raising Budget

description: For years, documenting protests in China was a task for political activists. Now, it’s capturing the attention of investors who are trying to predict if Beijing will pivot to a bazooka stimulus
title: Xi Stimulus Clues Found in Protest Data Showing Economic Stress

description: The Biden administration finalized restrictions on investments by US individuals and companies into advanced technology in China, including semiconductors, quantum computing and artificial intelligence.
title: Biden Finalizes Curbs on US Investment in Chinese Chip, AI Tech

description: Israel’s Knesset has passed a bill to sharply restrict the main United Nations organization supporting Palestinians, further threatening the already slow flow of humanitarian aid to displaced people in Gaza.
title: Israel Passes Law to Restrict the UN’s Main Aid Agency for Gaza

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Supreme Court reporter Greg Stohr explains why it’s unlikely the high court will make an election-deciding ruling. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump v. Harris? Odds Against Supreme Court Replay of 2000 Clash

description: The head of a major US utility trade group is stepping down after less than a year.
title: Former Trump Energy Head Steps Down From Utility Trade Group

description: The Republican Party has asked the US Supreme Court to stop Pennsylvanians from getting a second chance to vote in the Nov. 5 election if their mail-in ballots are rejected as incomplete.
title: Pennsylvania ‘Naked’ Ballots Fight Reaches US Supreme Court

description: Bolivia’s government accused Evo Morales of shooting at police after refusing to stop at a checkpoint, while the former president himself described the confused events on Sunday morning as an attempt to assassinate him.
title: Bolivian Government Says Ex-President Morales Shot at Police

description: Elon Musk predicted he could cut at least $2 trillion from the US federal budget, a lofty goal that would require a level of austerity unprecedented since the winding down of World War II.
title: Musk Wants $2 Trillion Cut From US Budget. It’d Be Difficult

description: The Bank for International Settlements is debating whether to shut down a pilot cross-border payments platform after Russia‘s President Vladimir Putin identified the underlying technology as a tool to circumvent sanctions and potentially undermine the dollar’s dominance in the global financial system.
title: BIS Debates Ending Project Eyed by Putin to Undermine Dollar

description: Thousands of protesters gathered in the Georgian capital Tbilisi late Monday, answering a call from President Salome Zourabichvili to oppose the outcome of parliamentary elections that she said were rigged in favor of Moscow.
title: Thousands Protest as Georgian President Says Vote Was ‘Stolen’

description: Foreign instigators linked to Russia and China are to blame for amplifying disinformation about the US government’s response to a pair of hurricanes that devastated several southeastern states, according to a US official.
title: Instigators Tied to Russia, China Spread Storm Disinformation

description: A group of European Union member states criticized Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban for what they called a “premature” visit to Georgia two days after an election that the Caucasus nation’s opposition said was rigged.
title: EU Ministers Slam Orban Over ‘Premature’ Visit to Georgia

description: A fire in a ballot box in southwestern Washington destroyed hundreds of ballots in a county where the congressional race could help determine control of the US House of Representatives.
title: Hundreds of Ballots Damaged in Drop-Box Fire in Washington State

description: The Nevada Supreme Court will allow state officials to count absentee ballots arriving without a postmark as many as three days after the Nov. 5 general election, rejecting a challenge brought by the Republican Party in the swing state.
title: Republicans Lose Fight Over Late-Arriving Mail Ballots in Nevada

description: SEATTLE (AP) — Authorities were investigating Monday after early morning fires were set in ballot drop boxes in Portland, Oregon, and in nearby Vancouver, Washington, where hundreds of ballots were destroyed.
title: Hundreds of Ballots Destroyed after Fires Set in Ballot Drop Boxes in Oregon, Washington

description: Long-shot, third-party candidate Juan Dalmau has surged to a virtual tie in Puerto Rico’s governor race, propelled by his pledge to end tax breaks for wealthy newcomers to the island.
title: Ending Tax Breaks for Wealthy Fuels Support in Puerto Rico Race

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he’s open to a short truce in the country’s war with Hamas that would lead to the release of a small number of the around 100 hostages still held by the Iran-backed militant group in Gaza.
title: Israel Open to Short Truce in Gaza After Hamas Leader’s Killing

description: Russia’s troops have reportedly captured the last town before Pokrovsk, which is a key logistics hub for Ukrainian forces in the Donetsk Region.
title: Russia Captures Center of Selydove, Stronghold in Ukraine’s East

description: A second presidential term for Donald Trump would likely bring about extreme protectionism, a large negative population shock and a surge of debt issuance to fund “totally undisciplined fiscal policy,” a top Canadian economist warned.
title: Scotiabank Economist Says Trump Win Would Bring ‘Ruinous’ Policy

description: South Africa filed a dossier with the International Court of Justice Monday containing what it said were “facts and evidence” to substantiate its case that Israel was committing a crime of genocide in the Gaza Strip.
title: South Africa Files Evidence in Israel Genocide Case

description: Former President Donald Trump is hoping to rally evangelical voters in Georgia while Vice President Kamala Harris is looking to shore up her standing on the economy during a tour across Michigan as the two candidates furiously campaign with just eight days until Election Day.
title: Harris, Trump Fan Out to Swing States; Musk Sued Over Giveaways

description: Indian banks are wary of facilitating trade with Russian firms to avoid falling afoul of US sanctions, said Denis Alipov, Moscow’s envoy to New Delhi.
title: US Sanctions Make Indian Banks Wary of Russia Trade, Envoy Says

description: Colorado Governor Jared Polis cast doubt on former President Donald Trump’s ability to carry out sweeping deportations if he returns to office, citing limited federal resources.
title: Colorado Governor Says Trump’s Deportation Threat Is Unrealistic

description: Elon Musk was sued by the Philadelphia district attorney over his political action committee’s $1 million a day sweepstakes targeting swing state voters in the final days of the US presidential election.
title: Elon Musk Sued Over $1 Million Election Giveaway in Philadelphia

description: The US Army is looking to speed up weapons development and procurement to keep up with evolving technology and make sure new equipment isn’t out of date before it gets into the hands of American soldiers, the Army chief of staff said in an interview.
title: US Army Works With Tech Companies to Speed Up Weapons Development

description: Virginia asked the US Supreme Court to revive the state’s purge of voter rolls in the final days of the presidential contest after lower courts blocked it.
title: Virginia Asks US Supreme Court to Allow Purge of Voter Rolls

description: After Iran said it would respond to Israel’s Saturday strikes on its missile and air defense systems in a corresponding fashion, the Israeli government moved its regular meeting to an undisclosed secret bunker.
title: Israeli Cabinet Meets in Secret Location After Iranian Threat

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy traveled to Iceland on Monday for a meeting with Nordic leaders as he seeks to secure support for the country’s war aims.
title: Zelenskiy Arrives in Iceland to Meet With Nordic Leaders

description: African countries face higher costs of financing because of inflated risk perceptions from credit-ratings companies, the head of the continent’s biggest bank said.
title: Ratings Bias Costs Africa Billions of Dollars, Standard CEO Says

description: Keir Starmer said his Labour government had no choice but to deliver unpopular tax rises and spending cuts at Wednesday’s budget, squarely blaming his Conservative predecessors for Britain’s ailing public finances and challenging them to explain what they would do differently.
title: Starmer Challenges His Critics Ahead of Make-or-Break UK Budget

description: The campaign for the US presidency enters its final week with Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump locked in a stubbornly close race, making starkly different pitches to motivate supporters and win over the few remaining persuadable voters.
title: Harris Plans ‘Freedom’ Rally, Trump Courts Men in Final Push

description: As diplomatic relations fray between India and Canada over the assassination of a Sikh separatist leader, the spotlight is now turning to one of India’s most notorious gangsters.
title: Infamous Crime Boss Becomes Pivotal Figure in India-Canada Spat

description: President Xi Jinping urged China to project more soft power, underscoring his campaign to make the nation more influential globally and challenge the US-led order.
title: Xi Calls On China to Find More Ways to Project Soft Power

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said he would remove Canada’s 5% national sales tax on new homes sold for under C$1 million ($719,700) if he’s elected prime minister.
title: Trudeau Rival Pledges to Axe Federal Sales Tax on Many New Homes

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: Japan’s Voters Humble a Wayward Ruling Party

description: The efforts to rebuild in Southeastern states after a pair of destructive hurricanes are at risk of being drawn out by shortages of a critical supply of workers: migrants.
title: Rebuilding From Hurricanes Hinges on Immigrants at Center of US Election

description: Israel expects a new laser system that can intercept rockets, drones and mortars at negligible cost to be operational next year after an accelerated manufacturing process.
title: Israel Readies New Laser Defense Against More Rocket Attacks

description: The sheer closeness of the US presidential race makes an election-determining Supreme Court showdown a possibility. It just isn’t likely.
title: Trump v. Harris? Replay of 2000 Election Clash Is a Supreme Court Long Shot

description: Venâncio Mondlane, the fiery opposition presidential candidate who was declared the runner-up in Mozambique’s Oct. 9 elections, warned of further protests against what he’s described as a fraudulent outcome.
title: Mozambican Opposition Leader Warns of Renewed Election Protests

description: Robinhood Markets Inc. is joining competitors in allowing retail traders to bet on election outcomes before next week’s US vote for president.
title: Robinhood Joins Elections Betting Game Ahead of Voting Day

description: Russia’s decision to bring North Korean troops to shore up its war-weary forces has Ukraine’s allies realizing they have few options to respond without escalating the conflict even more.
title: Ukraine Allies Face Limited Options as North Korea Troops Arrive

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.In November 2003, protests over disputed parliamentary elections in Georgia spiraled into the pro-Western Rose Revolution. Today may show whether the pendulum is swinging back.
title: Putin and the West Scrap Over Georgia’s Future

description: National oil companies tend to be more bloated and less efficient than their private-sector counterparts. Yet Petroleos Mexicanos, with a workforce of about 128,000, stands out even among its state-owned peers.
title: Pemex CEO Inherits One of World’s Most Inefficient Oil Companies

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party suspended a member of Parliament after video footage emerged appearing to show him punching a man.
title: Labour Suspends MP After Footage Emerges of Violent Altercation

description: Thailand’s leading business groups and commercial banks urged Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra to roll out fresh measures to spur consumer spending and tackle one of the highest levels of household debt levels in Asia.
title: Thai Business Groups Press for More Stimulus as Economy Sputters

description: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has vowed to stay on and stabilize the political situation after the ruling party’s worst electoral result since 2009. While he is expected to continue as premier for now, he may yet not survive a leadership vote due within 30 days in parliament, and even if he does it’s unclear how long his administration would hold together.
title: Possible Replacements for Japan’s PM Ishiba If He Steps Down

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim welcomed an apology from imprisoned former premier Najib Razak, who is seeking leniency for his crimes related to the multibillion dollar 1MDB scandal.
title: Malaysia PM Anwar Says He Welcomes Najib’s 1MDB Apology

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba promised Monday to take on the responsibility of restoring political stability following the loss of his ruling coalition’s majority in a lower house election for the first time since 2009.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Vows to Restore Stability After Losing Majority

description: As ambassador to Kenya, the former eBay and HP CEO has made a priority of counterbalancing Chinese influence on the continent.
title: Meg Whitman’s Mission in Africa: American Tech Over Chinese

description: Japan is entering a period of political uncertainty following an Oct. 27 election where the ruling Liberal Democratic Party and its junior partner lost their majority in parliament for the first time since a vote in 2009. The yen tumbled to a three-month low in the immediate aftermath as investors braced for a weaker administration. A 30-day clock was also set in motion for a new government to emerge, pitting the LDP against the main opposition Constitutional Democratic Party to build a majority
title: What Comes Next for Japan’s Ruling Party After Its Election Setback

description: Both would be better off today if they had honestly confronted the issues that motivated Brexit and that now drive nationalist-populism in Europe.
title: UK and EU Learn That to Divorce in Haste Is to Repent at Leisure

description: Chile’s center-right parties won some key races in local elections over the weekend, but failed to cement their dominance with one year left before the presidential vote.
title: Chile’s Center-Right Opposition Gains Ground in Local Elections

description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on Monday showed up at a Senate inquiry into his administration’s drug war that killed thousands, the first time he’s attending a probe by lawmakers since stepping down in 2022.
title: Philippines’ Ex-President Duterte Faces Senate Probe on Drug War

description: Uruguay’s presidential election will go to a runoff next month after neither candidate reached the absolute majority needed to win, while a contentious overhaul of the country’s pension system failed to pass.
title: Uruguay’s Election Goes to Runoff as Pension Reform Rejected

description: Puerto Rican rapper Bad Bunny expressed support for Vice President Kamala Harris after a speaker at Donald Trump’s rally in New York called the US territory a “floating island of garbage.”
title: Bad Bunny Signals Support for Harris After Trump Comedian’s Insult

description: Sao Paulo’s incumbent center-right mayor defeated a left-wing candidate in a setback for President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in Brazil’s municipal elections.
title: Lula’s Pick Loses in Sao Paulo, Capping Local Election Setback
